newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Northwest '96 passengers from Japan over 1.5 mln.
newsitem.headline: Northwest '96 passengers from Japan over 1.5 mln.

text.p: Northwest Airlines carried more than 1.5 million passengers from Japan in a year for the first time during 1996, an airline statement released here said.

The statement said a passenger flying to Minneapolis/St Paul from Tokyo Narita broke the one and a half million mark on December 21. Northwest carried more than one million passengers in 1992 and each calendar year until 1995 at its Japanese gateways; Tokyo, Osaka, Nagoya and Fukuoka.

Around 10 per cent of all travellers leaving from Japan fly Northwest which has the largest market share among foreign carriers serving Japan, the statement said. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+44 171 542-5017
